article.title: Hidden-charm pentaquarks and their hidden-bottom and $B_c$-like partner states

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **incorrect** regarding the decay properties of the nnncc¯ pentaquark states shown in Figure 3(a)?
choices: Most states are broad due to open-charm decay channels.
The Jᴾ=5/2⁻ state may have a relatively narrow width due to D-wave decay dominance.
Hidden-charm decay channels are suppressed due to the color transition from octet to singlet.
The decays into ηc∆ and ηcN for states with (I, J) = (3/2, 3/2) and (I, J) = (1/2, 5/2) respectively are enhanced by heavy quark spin-flip.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 3(a), which of the following statements is **correct** regarding the interpretation of the observed Pc(4380)?
choices: The Pc(4380) cannot be interpreted as a tightly bound pentaquark state with colored cc¯.
The Pc(4380) must be a Jᴾ=5/2⁻ state based on its mass and width.
The interpretation of the Pc(4380) as a tightly bound pentaquark state with colored cc¯ is possible, but its spin cannot be determined from this study.
The Pc(4380) must be a broad state with dominant hidden-charm decay channels.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of thresholds are used to estimate the pentaquark masses in Table IV?
Which hidden-bottom pentaquark system is likely to have three narrow Λ-like states with Jᴾ=1/2⁻ or 3/2⁻ and two Jᴾ=5/2⁻ states with relatively narrow widths according to Figure 4?
